text: Ilancueitl (Nahuatl for "old-woman skirt"; ) was the first queen of Tenochtitlan. ==Biography== Ilancuéitl was a daughter of the then ruler of Culhuacán, Acolmiztli, and she married Acamapichtli, the first ruler of Tenochtitlan. She bore no children, so her husband took more wives. Ilancuéitl charged herself with the education of her stepson Huitzilihuitl. ==See also== *List of Tenochtitlan rulers ==References== * ==External links== Category:Tenochca nobility Category:Queens of Tenochtitlan
title: Ilancueitl
